title.narrative: Study on Danish support to informally organised civil society and social movements in developing countries

description.narrative: The study will describe and analyse Danish support to informally organised civil society actors and social movements in developing countries. It will identify and assess facilitating factors and good practices as well as hampering factors and lessons learned from Danish support. It will also describe approaches among other donor agencies to supporting informally organised civil society actors and social movements. Against this background, the study will discuss and provide recommendations for how Danish support to informally organised civil society actors can be enhanced. The study will inform ongoing preparations of Danish civil society support, including through strategic partnership organisations. The study will provide recommendations on how to operationalize and strengthen efforts as part of Denmark’s development engagements to support human rights and democratic governance. The study will provide knowledge input of relevance for the Government’s 4 years plan on political inequality and the #DK4Democracy initiative.

organisation.narrative: Department for Evaluation, Learning and Quality
